strategy: Implement a neural network using Keras or TensorFlow to capture complex non-linear relationships in the data.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from keras.models import Sequential
from keras.layers import Dense
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Ensure all feature names are strings
X_train.columns = X_train.columns.astype(str)
X_test.columns = X_test.columns.astype(str)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Initialize imputer
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')

# Fit the encoder and imputer on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

X_train_imputed = imputer.fit_transform(pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_train, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), X_train.drop(categorical_features, axis=1)], axis=1))
X_test_imputed = imputer.transform(pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_test, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), X_test.drop(categorical_features, axis=1)], axis=1))

# Convert imputed features back to DataFrame and set feature names
X_train_final = pd.DataFrame(X_train_imputed, columns=[f'imputed_{i}' for i in range(X_train_imputed.shape[1])])
X_test_final = pd.DataFrame(X_test_imputed, columns=[f'imputed_{i}' for i in range(X_test_imputed.shape[1])])

# Add original encoded categorical features
